content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE; FINDINGS." summarizes the title and key findings of a section. The Act titled "EAC Reauthorization Act of 2017" addresses issues in the 2016 Federal elections, including foreign interference, deteriorating voting machine infrastructure, and lack of resources at the State and local levels. The Election Assistance Commission is crucial for improving election fairness, accuracy, accessibility, and efficiency. The EAC Reauthorization Act of 2017 aims to improve election fairness, accuracy, accessibility, and efficiency by providing best practices, information, and voting machine certifications to States. The Election Assistance Commission should have the necessary tools to help State and local election officials administer elections and ensure their accuracy, integrity, and security. The EAC Reauthorization Act of 2017 updates the Help America Vote Act by extending funding for the Election Assistance Commission until 2022. It also provides assistance to States for enhancing security measures in voter registration processes. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 is amended to authorize funding for upgrading the security of voter registration lists and processes for fiscal year 2018. Additionally, the 5-percent match requirement waiver is expanded to include subparagraphs (B) and (C). The Help America Vote Act of 2002 is amended to authorize funding for upgrading voter registration list security for fiscal year 2018. Subparagraph (A) waiver does not apply for determining State eligibility to receive requirements payment under section 257(a)(5). SEC. 4. ASSESSMENT OF ADEQUACY OF VOTING SYSTEMS AND MACHINES. The Election Assistance Commission will assess voting systems for the 2018 elections with a plan to replace outdated machines by December 31, 2017. The term "State" is defined in the Help America Vote Act of 2002. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 will now require states to participate in post-general election surveys under a new section 303A. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 now mandates states to provide information for post-general election surveys as per section 303A, effective from the November 2018 election onwards. SEC. 6. REPORTS BY NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF STANDARDS AND TECHNOLOGY ON USE OF FUNDS TRANSFERRED FROM ELECTION ASSISTANCE COMMISSION. Section 231 of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 is amended to require a report on the use of funds transferred from the Election Assistance Commission to the Director of the National Institute of Standards and Technology. The Director must certify and submit a report detailing the use of funds within 90 days after the end of the fiscal year. This amendment applies to fiscal year 2018 and onwards. The Election Assistance Commission will assess the security and effectiveness of its information technology systems, including cybersecurity, by December 31, 2017. Additionally, the Commission will review and streamline State-based administrative complaint procedures for investigating violations of the Help America Vote Act of 2002. Recommendations will be submitted to Congress by the end of 2017. The Commission will submit a report to Congress by December 31, 2017, with recommendations to streamline and improve procedures related to the review conducted on State-based administrative complaint procedures.
